message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CE

Reasoning: 
- cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a new design of intelligent reflecting surface (IRS) assisted non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) transmission, which involves information theory concepts such as channel capacity and signal-to-interference-plus-noise ratio (SINR).
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The proposed scheme involves multiple users accessing the same channel, which is a common problem in networking and internet architecture. The paper also discusses the impact of hardware impairments on the proposed scheme, which is relevant to this sub-category.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a system design that involves controlling the directions of users' channel vectors using IRS, which is relevant to this sub-category.
- cs.MM (Multimedia): The proposed scheme can be used for multimedia transmission, as it can serve more users on each orthogonal spatial direction than spatial division multiple access (SDMA).
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper involves designing a computational system for IRS-NOMA transmission, which is relevant to this sub-category.
